alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, southern Caroline and northwestern King William Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kings Dominion, or 8 miles south of Milford, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dawn around 720 PM EDT. Mangohick around 735 PM EDT. Beulahville and Newtown around 745 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Calno, Gether, Owenton, Burruss Corner, Globe, Pollards Corner, Upshaw, Etna Mills, Duane Fork and Penola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central, north central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western King William; Western King and Queen
